title: Great experience
comment: Works amazingly. Small request: please display thumbnails for jpeg instead of genetic photo of exclamation sign

Once you have Seafile up and running, it's very reliable. The Android client works very well, but if the data store is located on a slow connection or a slow hard drive, the Android client will time out from time to time when refreshing a folder.  I would like to see some more features included in the Android client, such as tighter integration with other apps, ability to copy or move files to other folders within Seafile, and an option to download files to other locations on my Android. Currently, files are downloaded to the Seafile folder by default.  All in all, a great program.

title: No thumbnails
comment: Wished it showed thumbnails instead of simple file lists,  can't find anything this way.....  Uninstalled.

title: Good job
comment: Update: The features desired by me were implemented meanwhile. Thus - 5 stars. ----- 02.02.14. Works gold, but i'm missing some functions. First of all a function for automatic camera upload like the Dropbox does. And (maybe there is a function and i'm too stupid to find it) a possibility to remove cached objects out of the cache (the local storage) again. Excepting those two issues - great work :-)
Great gallery update! Love the ability to scroll through photos in full screen
Few bugs

title: No thumbnails/ preview
comment: No thumbnails on pictures. I necessarily have to download each picture to know  the one I want. Please answer, this issue has been posted also on the forum but no answer came so far. Am I the only one??

title: works flawlessly
comment: all as expected

title: Nice
comment: Useful!!
Fantastic

title: Great!
comment: I would like to be able to have more sharing options like password protected links with expiration date. And a little better UI would be awesome.

title: Just ok..
comment: I really love everything behind Seafile but the Android app seriously lacks...  My main issue at the moment is that every file I upload, once it's done, they're all listed as "unknown file".. I wonder if it has to do with my file manager that I use to select files with (amaze).. Problem is the stock file manager on my LG g2 just stinks and I don't want to use it and I've gotten very acclimated to Amaze..  I host the server myself and the web interface is pretty good but it too could use more features.

title: Great
comment: Secure, free...  Like dropbox but better.
Seafile is great. The android app less so. For the last few versions, the UI is increadibly nonresponsive and the photo upload doesn't reliably happen. Update: the nonresponsiveness issue is fixed.

title: Used too...
comment: I did have this working before. Now  I don't know if its the update (Did update Seafile server / Android to 5.0), if its the phone or what. But it's not connection at all. I get an unknown status code error when connecting. Tablet isn't connection as well. I love Seafile and will continue to use it, just hope this app works again at one point or another. Will update if I find the cause.   (Update)  I did find the cause, when the phone would auto-fill my email address. it puts a space after the email that obviously doesn't show.. Seafile does not accept this what so ever. Found this wasn't just through the app but even though all the browser. App is working, but that wasn't a fun experience.

title: perfect, free, and open source
comment: even the server side. many thanks. ;-)

title: Seafile
comment: Excelent app!

title: Best private syncing solution
comment: Seafile server and desktop provide superb syncing performance. If the app gets a bit more attention as it deserves, this may very well be the best synchronise app for android

title: Moving files
comment: Have to move files one by one, no sign of multi file select to move as a group
Does not upload videorecordings.

title: Good start
comment: I like what the app does for the most part. The server component is impressive. However the android app  may benefit from more improvements. For example, I can't currently tell the status of an upload. In cases where I had a poor connection, I didn't realize when the transfer was complete or if it failed.

title: Cannot upload files on SD Card?
comment: I really love the auto upload feature, but there is no way to pick the directories that are monitored, so setting the camera to save to the SD card results in no pictures being uploaded go seafile. :(

title: APK basic (v1.4.2 - edited 3rd Feb)
comment: seafile is a good product but more work needed with android app. The biggest problem is not rotating with device, landscape missing using nexus. No visual improvement with 1.4.2

title: Activity is not working.
comment: No activity now or the function is not supported.

title: Waiting for Android client to catch up...
comment: The desktop client has everything I need, and more. I would love to see this kind of power in the mobile client. Nevertheless, mobile seems to work ok, even if it is not even close to desktop when you compare ease of use.

title: latest update broke export
comment: I cannot share a file to seafile anymore.   When i try to share a file, i keep getting presented with the "please setup an account first" splash screen.  Meanwhile i have my account set up and it is working perfectly except for the sharing.

title: Crashes on opening and sharing
comment: Crashes on opening and sharing all the time

title: Infant android app
comment: While I think that the pc version is perfect, the android version is completely useless. You better off using the web client than this app. The web client has all the functionality one needs, that doesn't work on this android app.

title: Crashes when exporting files
comment: Seafile is great but I'm unable to export even a text file to Google drive or anywhere in fact. Once working it will be 5 stars.
good apps

title: Not for the non-geek
comment: Android client looks great.  Unfortunately, their documentation is lacking and looks out-dated.  I've been using multiple flavors of linux since 1996 and I still had issues getting this running.  There appears to be some assumed knowledge and they spent time documenting details that are a bit more obvious.  I suggest OwnCloud even though it's UI sucks but it syncs while mobile.

title: Seafile is brilliant
comment: As much respect as I have for the owncloud project, seafile performs so much better that it's just a no brainer at this point. Excellent Dropbox replacement for those who need a lot of storage space (and are willing to self host)

title: Getting better
comment: Camera upload is cool addition. But one feature that I need is syncing with mobile device

title: Great app
comment: Great application. I've been using since first version and this guys made a good job.
Cute app for backup and sync everywhere. Ability to play video/music on the fly would be a nice feature. Especially from mobiles....

title: Not working in private server + nginx
comment: My server uses nginx for proxy and the app do not allow me to login

title: Could be better
comment: Looks promising, but camera upload or folder sync it's a must.

title: Lack of features
comment: Been using windows version for months, but this mobile app is missing so much features such as a link in share option, browse to external sdcard, auto sync and upload multiple files. It will be great if those features is added

title: Good start but needs sync
comment: Sync is necessary to be on par with desktop clients and other cloud services. Other than that missing essential feature, it seems to do what it is supposed to. And good on you for the open source philosophy!

title: Nice start. Some more functions required.
comment: This is in general a nice client. With automatic camera upload coming in fall it will be much better.  But please include the upload of multiple files. Right now its super annoying that you can only select files one by one from the android menu, to share/upload with seafile.

title: Unfinished
comment: Needs auto upload and other features but good start

title: Needs auto sync
comment: Please add auto sync. That's what cloud storage apps are about. Otherwise they are useless.

title: Amazing app
comment: But if you look at something in the app it always safes right to your phone. Would be better if download and just looking would be separate.

title: Nice gui but no auto sync sucks.
comment: This app so simple that it's basically not usable. Going to try ownCloud. Love the Web interface but this app needs help.

title: Great solution but really poor mobile app
comment: Using server six months now.  Maybe the best solution I have ever seen. Regular updates, constant improvements. Overall stability even under heavy load. But mobile app is really crippled. I would gladly pay for auto refresh and auto upload.

title: Great share server but crap app
comment: Important. Made my Sony Xperia Z2 go black screen and crash, did the same to my Samsung Galaxy tab 3, seems to drain memory. Please fix this. I Love the server it's as good as Dropbox. But the Android app is useless and when you try upload from the phone external sd card, the app just crashes straight away. Using a Sony Xperia Z2
Autosync!

title: Seafiles on the go
comment: Very nice app to get access to your Seafiles on the go. Nice interface, well done. But please enable activities, which currently is not supported.  Additional support for other Seahub features would be appreciated.

title: A must have app to use with a must have cloud storage server.
comment: Easy to use, very functional mobile app to use with a Seafile host. I'm very impressed with how well the entire Seafile system works overall. Best of all, the consistent updates to the server software and client apps are making this cloud storage system very hard to ignore. Kudos devs.

title: seafile
comment: please add autorefresh, it's killing me
Nice app, but even after the fix for samsung phones, it's a big hassle to upload from sd card.
Nice app but please add auto upload/download functionality then I would rate this 5 stars

title: Works great
comment: Much better than Owncloud :)

title: Nice!
comment: Works very nicely!  Love it!

title: Unique
comment: Seafile is a dream come true.

title: Works well!
comment: Just a little glitch addingvyour first account (private). Feature request is to be able to add libraries and do be able to select a list of files or folders to upload.

title: very good open source product
comment: recommended

title: It's not too good
comment: There are main features missing in the client. There is no possibility to download whole library, it does not auto sync - has to refresh every each run. Please fix it, without these features there is no use of the client.

title: Multiple upload/download
comment: It is useful! But if the app has multiple upload/dowanload and download folders feature it will be better. Thanks for your affort

title: Decent app, needs more docs for self hosted.
comment: Works as designed, but could use more examples for hooking to self hosted, and better error messages.

title: Good work
comment: Works with Nexus 5 (server version 2.1.3.). Missing possibility to upload multiple photos from Gallery.

title: Works well but lacks features.
comment: I was hoping this would replace drop box for me but it has no auto picture and video upload. If that was added this would be a perfect app.

title: Full-featured client
comment: Works remarkably well, providing the full breadth of functionality I would expect given the web interface, including full support for viewing markdown files.  Nice work!

title: Autoupload would make app perfect.
comment: Everything is OK, GUI looks nice, no errors so far. But auto-upload is a must for a cloud app. I really hope for this function in near future.

title: A lot of features missing
comment: Can't choose local folder, can't download whole directories or libraries, does not auto-sync. Too much missing for a syncing app!

title: Uninstalled
comment: Unable to connect to server via the Android app. Works just fine on my iPhone and in my browser (both mobile and desktop) but does not work in the Android App.

title: And it works
comment: Again!

title: Decent
comment: Stopped working after recent update on HTC Rezound , worked well before, showes empty folder, folder is not empty...

title: It's ok
comment: Some minor things: if I edit a file on my device, the text seems to be saved locally, but the new version is not synchronised to the server. Also, the app registers as a share activity for url's, but does not know what to do with them. Otherwise shaping up quite nicely!

title: can't download file
comment: can't download file from private seafile server

title: Very good idea. Needs work.
comment: Needs some additional features. I would love for this to replace my dropbox. An auto-sync feature would be amazing.

title: Could be better
comment: Very limited functionality. Serves its purpose though. Please keep on improving!

title: Works very well. Misses some features.
comment: The idea behind Seafile is to keep shared files in sync and using the version control mechanism of git to enable different people to work on the same files without stress. You can use free or paid space at seacloud.cc or set up your own server on your own hardware or pay someone to do that for you. I am using the client with a Seafile-server I installed on a computer (a cheap and energy saving raspberry pi) in my local network at home. Setting the server up was surprisingly easy and it runs good on the slow pi. The Android-Seafile-client works fine and is definitely well done. But I can’t choose the location of the folder corresponding to a library and it does not synchronize automatically complete folders (and sub-folders) as the Ubuntu-Linux-client does. That is a major issue for me. Besides that, I like the client and the server. Very good job!
